Title: Azure Developer CLI (azd) ‚Äì February 2026: JMESPath Queries & Deployment Slots
EnhancedContent:
Here‚Äôs what shipped in `azd` this February! This post covers release versions [1.23.3](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/releases/tag/azure-dev-cli_1.23.3), [1.23.4](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/releases/tag/azure-dev-cli_1.23.4), [1.23.5](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/releases/tag/azure-dev-cli_1.23.5), and [1.23.6](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/releases/tag/azure-dev-cli_1.23.6).

To share your feedback and questions, join the [February release discussion on GitHub](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/discussions/6854).

**Highlights:**

- JMESPath query support for filtering and transforming JSON output
- Deploy to Azure App Service deployment slots directly from `azd`
- Automatically install `azd`
extensions in dev containers
- New `--subscription`
and `--location` flags for `azd provision` and `azd up`
- Extension version requirements with `requiredAzdVersion`
- Remote build support for Azure Functions Flex Consumption plans

## New features

### üîç Query and output

`azd` now supports JMESPath queries, giving you the ability to filter and transform JSON output directly in the terminal.

- **JMESPath query support**: The new `--query`
flag lets you filter and transform JSON output from any `azd` command using [JMESPath](https://jmespath.org/) expressions‚Äîgreat for scripting and automation. Query support also covers `Message` -type outputs, so filtering works consistently across all commands. For a deep dive, see our 1-min blog post: [JMESPath query support in azd](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sdk/azd-jmespath-query-support/). Thanks [@scottaddie](https://github.com/scottaddie) for the contribution! [\[#6664\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6664) [\[#6735\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6735)

### üöÄ Deployment and infrastructure

Several improvements streamline the deployment experience, from deployment slot support to more flexible provisioning workflows.

- **App Service deployment slot support**: `azd`
now deploys directly to Azure App Service deployment slots without extra scripts. For details, see our 1-min blog post: [Deploy to App Service slots with azd](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sdk/azd-app-service-slot/). [\[#6627\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6627)
- **Subscription and location flags**: New `--subscription`
and `--location` flags for `azd provision` and `azd up` allow overriding defaults per command without changing global or environment configuration. [\[#6777\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6777)
- **Remote build for Functions Flex Consumption**: New `remoteBuild`
configuration option enables remote builds when deploying to Azure Functions Flex Consumption plans, avoiding local build requirements. [\[#6748\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6748)

### üîå Extensions

- **Required azd version for extensions**: Extensions can now specify a `requiredAzdVersion`
field, ensuring users run a compatible version of `azd` before the extension loads. [\[#6747\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6747)

### üê≥ Dev containers

- **Automatically install extensions in dev containers**: The `azd`
dev container feature now supports an `extensions` option, so you can specify `azd` extensions to install automatically when a dev container is built. For details, see our 1-min blog post: [Automatically install azd extensions in dev containers](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sdk/azd-devcontainer-extensions/). Thanks [@stuartleeks](https://github.com/stuartleeks) for the contribution! [\[#6460\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6460)

### ü§ñ AI and automation

- **AI coding agent auto-detection**: `azd`
now detects when it‚Äôs running inside an AI coding agent and skips interactive prompts automatically, so automated workflows don‚Äôt hang. [\[#6633\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6633)

## ü™≤ Bugs fixed

### CLI and terminal

- Fixed arrow keys displaying as escape sequences in the Ghostty terminal emulator. [\[#6739\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6739)
- Fixed missing configuration keys not appearing in `azd config options`
. [\[#6619\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6619)

### Deployment and infrastructure

- Fixed remote build returning 404 errors when Azure Container Registry is in a different resource group than the target resource. [\[#6766\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6766)
- Fixed subscription cache being overwritten when switching between subscriptions. [\[#6770\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6770)
- Fixed `azd init`
to fail fast when required values are missing in non-interactive mode. [\[#6779\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6779)

### Extensions and configuration

- Fixed duplicate `azd-service-name`
tag error during provisioning. [\[#6674\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6674)
- Fixed extension namespace conflicts when multiple extensions define overlapping namespaces. [\[#6671\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6671)
- Fixed environment variable substitution for array and object Bicep parameter types. [\[#6694\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6694)
- Fixed `azd env config set`
to support non-string types (numbers, booleans). [\[#6789\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6789)
- Fixed telemetry event bundling issues. [\[#6698\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6698)

## Other changes

- Improved provisioning error messages with more actionable guidance. [\[#6690\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6690)
- Improved error messages when provisioning fails due to region SKU unavailability, including suggestions for alternative regions. [\[#6771\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6771)
- Improved error classification for better telemetry and troubleshooting. [\[#6803\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6803)
- Improved delegated authentication messaging during interactive login flows. Thanks [@scottaddie](https://github.com/scottaddie) for the contribution! [\[#6808\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6808)
- Added soft-delete conflict detection hints when resource creation fails due to previously deleted resources. [\[#6810\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6810)
- Refactored container helper for improved maintainability. [\[#6649\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/6649)

## New docs

The Azure Developer CLI documentation continues to expand:

- **Layered provisioning** (February 12): New guide covering layered provisioning patterns for managing shared and environment-specific infrastructure in `azd`
projects. [Learn more](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/developer/azure-developer-cli/layered-provisioning)
- **Full-stack deployment guide** (January 28): New content on deploying full-stack applications with `azd`
, covering frontend, backend, and database components. [Learn more](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/developer/azure-developer-cli/full-stack-deployment)
- **Multi-tenant authentication guidance** (January 29): Updated guidance on configuring `azd`
for multi-tenant authentication scenarios. [Learn more](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/developer/azure-developer-cli/faq#how-do-i-authenticate-across-multiple-tenants)

## üôã‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è New to azd?

If you‚Äôre new to the Azure Developer CLI, `azd` is an open-source command-line tool that accelerates the time it takes to get your application from local development environment to Azure. `azd` provides best practice, developer-friendly commands that map to key stages in your workflow, whether you‚Äôre working in the terminal, your editor or CI/CD.
